title: Ndubuisi Egbo
text:
Ndubuisi Emmanuel Egbo (born 25 July 1973) is a <a href="Nigerian">Nigerian</a> 
<a href="Manager%20%28association%20football%29">football manager</a> and former footballer.
Egbo played as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a> during his professional career, most notably representing Tirana, winning with them three trophies. He was also a player of <a href="Nigeria%20national%20football%20team">Nigeria national team</a>, playing 12 matches and representing it in two tournaments of <a href="African%20Cup%20of%20Nations">African Cup of Nations</a>.
Club career.
Egbo previously played for <a href="NITEL%20Vasco%20Da%20Gama%20F.C.">NITEL Vasco Enugu</a>, <a href="NEPA%20Lagos">NEPA Lagos</a> and <a href="Julius%20Berger%20F.C.">Julius Berger</a> in the <a href="Nigeria%20Premier%20League">Nigeria Premier League</a>, for <a href="Moroka%20Swallows">Moroka Swallows</a> in the <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>n <a href="Premier%20Soccer%20League">Premier Soccer League</a>, for <a href="El-Masry">El-Masry</a> in the <a href="Egyptian%20Premier%20League">Egyptian Premier League</a>, and for <a href="KF%20Tirana">KF Tirana</a> and <a href="KF%20Bylis%20Ballsh">Bylis Ballsh</a> in the <a href="Albanian%20Superliga">Albanian Superliga</a>.
International career.
Egbo has made several appearances for the full <a href="Nigeria%20national%20football%20team">Nigeria national football team</a>. He was a member of the Nigeria squad at the <a href="2000%20African%20Cup%20of%20Nations">2000</a> and <a href="2002%20African%20Cup%20of%20Nations">2002 African Cup of Nations</a>.
Managerial career.
On 17 October 2015, after the sacking of <a href="Shk%C3%ABlqim%20Mu%C3%A7a">Shkëlqim Muça</a> following 1–1 home draw against <a href="Flamurtari%20Vlor%C3%AB">Flamurtari Vlorë</a>, both assistants of Muça were appointed temporarily the new managers of <a href="KF%20Tirana">KF Tirana</a>. Egbo became the first ever Nigerian coach to lead a European team to a league title after his team were crowned <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Kategoria%20Superiore">2019/2020 Albanian League champions</a>, the team also qualified for the <a href="Uefa%20Champions%20League">Uefa Champions League</a>.
Managerial statistics.
Last updated 31 August 2020
